criterion_requirments.name: Exhaustion of the 12-month regular unemployment benefit.
To have completed a continuous period of unemployment for 12 months by the date of submitting the relevant application and to remain registered in the unemployment registers of DYPA.

To be aged between 20 and 66 years. The date of birth of the beneficiary is considered the starting date for completing the 20th and 66th year. The critical time for meeting the age limit requirement is the time of application submission.

Their annual family income should not exceed €10,000. This income is increased by €586.08 for each minor child (i.e., under 18 years old). Thus, for example, for a client with two (2) minor children, their annual family income should not exceed the amount of €11,172.16 (€10,000 + €586.08 + €586.08 = €11,172.16). Note: the annual family income is considered to be the total annual taxable, actual, exempt, or specially taxed income from all sources—excluding severance pay—of the client, their spouse, and their minor children for the tax year preceding the exercise of the right. For example, for applications submitted in the year 2022, citizens will need to provide a tax assessment notice for the tax year 2020. Unemployment, sickness, maternity, and long-term unemployment benefits (for any disbursement in the following calendar year) are not included in the annual family income. For adult single beneficiaries, the family income is considered to be the individual income.
